name: CreateGithubPullRequest
description:
Create a draft pull request on GitHub repositories.

Use this tool to create a draft pull request on a specified GitHub repository. Requires write access to the head or source branch. Suitable for users with appropriate permissions on public, private or organization-owned repositories.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the GitHub repository. Case-insensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository for the pull request. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: target_branch
parameters.description: The branch name where changes are to be merged. Must be an existing branch in the current repository.

value_schema.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

parameters.name: source_branch
parameters.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. Use `username:branch` format for cross-repository cases.

value_schema.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

parameters.name: pull_request_content
parameters.description: The descriptive content or message for the pull request.

value_schema.description: The contents of the pull request.

parameters.name: source_repository_name
parameters.description: Name of the repository where changes in the pull request were made. Required for cross-repository pull requests within the same organization.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository where the changes in the pull request were made. This field is required for cross-repository pull requests if both repositories are owned by the same organization.

parameters.name: issue_number_for_conversion
parameters.description: Specify the issue number in the repository to convert into a pull request. Required unless a title is provided.

value_schema.description: An issue in the repository to convert to a pull request. The issue title, body, and comments will become the title, body, and comments on the new pull request. Required unless `title` is specified.

parameters.name: pull_request_title
parameters.description: The title of the new pull request. This is required unless an `issue` is specified.

value_schema.description: The title of the new pull request. Required unless `issue` is specified.

parameters.name: is_draft
parameters.description: Set to true to create the pull request as a draft. See GitHub documentation for more on draft pull requests.

value_schema.description: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft. See "[Draft Pull Requests](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/articles/about-pull-requests#draft-pull-requests)" in the GitHub Help documentation to learn more.

parameters.name: maintainers_can_modify
parameters.description: Indicates if maintainers can modify the pull request. Set to true to allow modifications.

value_schema.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

value_schema.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The contents of the pull request.

value_schema.description: The contents of the pull request.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft. See "[Draft Pull Requests](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/articles/about-pull-requests#draft-pull-requests)" in the GitHub Help documentation to learn more.

value_schema.description: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft. See "[Draft Pull Requests](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/articles/about-pull-requests#draft-pull-requests)" in the GitHub Help documentation to learn more.

parameters.name: head
parameters.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

value_schema.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

parameters.name: head_repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository where the changes in the pull request were made. This field is required for cross-repository pull requests if both repositories are owned by the same organization.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository where the changes in the pull request were made. This field is required for cross-repository pull requests if both repositories are owned by the same organization.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: An issue in the repository to convert to a pull request. The issue title, body, and comments will become the title, body, and comments on the new pull request. Required unless `title` is specified.

value_schema.description: An issue in the repository to convert to a pull request. The issue title, body, and comments will become the title, body, and comments on the new pull request. Required unless `title` is specified.

parameters.name: maintainer_can_modify
parameters.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

value_schema.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the new pull request. Required unless `issue` is specified.

value_schema.description: The title of the new pull request. Required unless `issue` is specified.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
